Method:
1. heat stock in pot over medium-high 2. heat a large rondeaux or tilt skillet and add canola oil 30 ml 3. add mushrooms and sear quickly until slightly softened, remove from head and keep for later steps 4. heat rondeaux again and add oil to cover the whole surface of it's bottom, approx 100 ml 5. add onion, garlic and carrot cooking lightly 6. add all of the dry arborio string with wooden spoon to coast all the grains of rice with fat and smoked paprika 7. when grains begin to lightly color begind by adding the first 1/3rd of the hot stock to the rondeaux 8. stir/ cook liquid out until nearly dry 9. repeat adding another third and cooking until dry 10 repeat a thrid time using the last of the stock 11. season with lemon zest, salt, pepper, thyme, olive oil and the cooked mushrooms while continueing to cook 12. cook until rice is just past "al dante" 13.lay cooked rice onto a parchment covered baking sheet to cool in the fridge 14. use cooling log, store, label and rotated this item with older product correctly and diligently

1) Remove all leaves from thick stem.

3) Final product should be thin strips that can be used for garnish. Cut only what you need for the day, as they do not last very long.
